paper.title: Partitioning of logic graphs: A theoretical analysis of pin reduction

author.org: IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center Yorktown Heights, New York,

paper.abstract: Formulae are derived for the number of pins required by the average partition of a computer logic graph. These formulae are used to construct curves relating the number of pins required by a group of blocks in a graph with certain statistical properties to the number of blocks in the group. The average effect of the two factors which contribute to pin reduction is discussed.
